docs.snippet: Sitting on the ground beside her hut, Bangon Phailak chopped up wild plants for lunch and pondered a wrenching question.     What does her 4-year-old daughter need more, food or a mother?...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sitting on the ground beside her hut, Bangon Phailak chopped up wild plants for lunch and pondered a wrenching question. What does her 4-year-old daughter need more, food or a mother?
docs.abstract: First of two articles, The Human Crisis, discusses effect of Asian financial crisis on poor people in Ban Wan Yai and other Thai villages; most prominent victims of crisis have been humbled tycoons in big cities, but they are neither most common victims nor most desperate; worst off are people who are already at margins of society--those who had almost nothing before and who have even less now; experts predict that crisis will result in increases in malnutrition and death rates; say legacy of crisis will be felt long after region's economies improve; map; photos (M)

headline.main: Asia Feels Strain Most at Society's Margins

docs.snippet: The U.S. State Department will allow people with valid visas into the United States, a department official said on Saturday, in order to comply with an opinion from a federal judge in Seattle barring President Donald Trump's executive action....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. State Department will allow people with valid visas into the United States, a department official said on Saturday, in order to comply with an opinion from a federal judge in Seattle barring President Donald Trump's executive action.

docs.snippet: WEST BERLIN, Feb. 22 Erich Honecker, the Communist Party leader, said today that East Germans would not be granted rights of free travel to the West so long as West Germany maintained its contention that there was no separate East German nationali...
docs.lead_paragraph: WEST BERLIN, Feb. 22 Erich Honecker, the Communist Party leader, said today that East Germans would not be granted rights of free travel to the West so long as West Germany maintained its contention that there was no separate East German nationality.
docs.abstract: Honecker says E Gers will not be granted rights of free travel to West so long as W Ger maintains its contention that there is no separate E Ger nationality, int in W Ger daily, Saarbruecker Zeitung; issue of Ger nationality has been subject of controversy in W Ger recently following suggestions by W Ger envoy to E Berlin, Guenter Gaus, that W Ger should show more flexibility on citizenship question (S)

docs.snippet: ACCORDS To the Editor:          The United States Helsinki Watch Committee seeks implementation of the human rights provisions of the 1975 Helsinki accords, among them the commitment by the 35 signatory nations ''to facilitate free movement and co...
docs.lead_paragraph: ACCORDS To the Editor: The United States Helsinki Watch Committee seeks implementation of the human rights provisions of the 1975 Helsinki accords, among them the commitment by the 35 signatory nations ''to facilitate free movement and contacts'' across national borders.v.e believe that the spirit of that commitment is violated by the ban on travel to Iran. Without in any way endorsing the actions of the 10 Americans who recently traveled to Iran, we call on President Carter and the United States Department of Justice to renounce any intent to prosecute them and to rescind the Federal regulations imposing the travel ban.

docs.snippet: The freer flow of people, goods and ideas could help nurture openness and reforms on the island....
docs.lead_paragraph: The freer flow of people, goods and ideas could help nurture openness and reforms on the island.
docs.abstract: Editorial calls for end ban on Americans traveling to Cuba; supports Senate bill that would end ban; urges Congress to reconcile Senate and House foreign aid bills in way that will enable private entrepreneurs to invest in Cuba and reduce sanctions on country.
